channel.title: Baseball on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Baseball on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Otis Nixon, the CD-i, and Me
item.description: *Editor’s note: Once I heard this story from my pal D. Frank Smith about America’s Team, the Atlanta Braves, and the worst console of a generation, I knew I had to share it with you guys. Enjoy!*   [big]“Is that Otis Nixon?” I asked my dad as we walked through an Atlanta mall in 1992.[/big] It took a moment to adjust my eyes to reality, because Nixon was wearing a suit, not his traditional Atlanta Braves uniform, likely because he was doing an endorsement.

item.title: Take me out to the riot
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: This weekend marks the opening day of the 2015 season of Major League Baseball—a sport that you find either immensely fascinating or overrated compared to more action-packed sports like football or basketball. Baseball has never completely lost the public’s fascination, though it’s certainly had some rough periods over the years. And sometimes, the fans can be total jerks. Today’s issue of Tedium covers what it’s like to be in the midst of a crowd of annoying baseball fans.
